content:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

plt.style.use('seaborn')
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))

labels = ['Point 1', 'Point 3', 'Point 5', 'Point 7', 'Point 9', 'Point 11']
values = [100.0, 50.0, 20.0, 10.0, 5.0, 115.0]

# Calculate cumulative values
cumulative = np.cumsum(values)
starts = np.concatenate([[0], cumulative[:-1]])

# Create waterfall
for i, (label, value, start) in enumerate(zip(labels, values, starts)):
    color = 'green' if value >= 0 else 'red'
    ax.bar(i, value, bottom=start, color=color, edgecolor='black')

ax.set_xticks(range(len(labels)))
ax.set_xticklabels(labels, rotation=45, ha='right')
ax.set_ylabel('Cumulative Value')
ax.set_title('Profit Breakdown')
ax.grid(True, alpha=0.3, axis='y')
ax.axhline(y=0, color='black', linestyle='-', linewidth=0.8)

plt.tight_layout()
description: Data extracted from user request for Profit Breakdown showing an upward trend from 100.00 to 115.00
insights: Peak at Point 11 (115.00), lowest at Point 9 (5.00)
